website_summaries.verdict: A good kit to get started with watch repair. Highlights here include a wrench for opening larger watches and a 41-page guide book.
pros: Comes with a wide range of tools for watch repair, including a link remover, 3x pin punch, and an extra large 3-point case wrench
41-page guide book that is included is a good introduction to watch repair
Most buyers felt this was a good quality starter kit
cons: Some reports of this kit arriving with broken/bent tools, used, or missing items

customer_reviews.title: A Decent Beginner's Kit
customer_reviews.text: This kit is well packaged and the instruction booklet is helpful and in color on quality paper. I used the bracelet re-sizing tool (blue device) twice so far and it worked perfectly. The hammer worked well also to reinsert the pins into the bracelet without scratching the metal. The overall quality of this kit is good, keeping in mind the cost. I do not have a long-term review yet. This kit is ideal for a beginner in watch self-servicing. It can also be used as a guide to what the more expensive counterpart tools would be beneficial to have.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Kit!
customer_reviews.text: This is a FANTASTIC kit for the money and one that I have already used to repair two watches, and replace batteries on another three!! The booklet is easy to use, gives good directions and is clear. The ONLY problem I had/have is the case wrench socket sizes for the little 'bits' that fit into the wrench. They are not as easy to use. One bit had to be forced in and a second bit socket is actually loose. HOWEVER, these shortcomings are fixable! I am delighted with the kit and yes, would buy it again, or get it for a friend who wanted one. Oh, and Customer Service is EXCELLENT!! They really follow up and support you.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvi S.

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and useful tool kit!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this wonderful tool kit to help me replace various watch batteries. The kit arrived in perfect condition with an invaluable instruction manual. I will probably study the manual first before embarking on my watch repair projects. Thanks to Hollythorn Industries for staying in touch with each customer. They make sure you are satisfied with their product and will do everything possible to correct any shipment issues one may have. Great company to deal with! I highly recommend ordering any products from them . . . . Respectfully, Jose A. Fernandez
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A. FERNANDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: For the hobbyist (me) , this kit is most likely all you'll need. Is it top level quality? No. Of course not at this price. But for that price you do get an awful lot of very-acceptable quality gear. Everything you need for minor watch repair/alteration is in here and as long as you're not going to be working on 10 watches a day, you really can't go wrong with this little kit. I added my own spring bar to it and now have everything I need to work on my/family watches as/when I need to. Don't anticipate needing anything else. Great value for money here.
customer_reviews.author: NibberJammies

customer_reviews.title: Go slow as you learn to use the tools!
customer_reviews.text: After a bit of learning the tools are great. The kit is versatile and accurate for the several types of watches our family has. A plus is that the tool works well and easy once you learn the needed techniques - it makes changing batteries and adjusting watchband fit to a wrist. A negative is that the instruction manual is a translation from (probably) Chinese and lacks clarity. Must read carefully and try to understand the word usage before working on a watch. But it IS a GOOD set of tools and performs fine once you get the "feel" of the tools.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C. Hand Jr.

customer_reviews.title: You never know til you need one
customer_reviews.text: I've had minimal success changing batteries on most of these e-watches, almost always due to lack of proper tools. I bought a more expensive watch that I didn't want to toss out if the battery failed, so I bought this kit, which can be used for many things besides watches......but I needed it on my new watch, and - had it - made the battery change a breeze because I had the PROPER TOOLS. Shouldn't need to say much more than that. If you like keeping watches and having tight fitting glasses - have this around the house. No telling what else you might use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good set for the careful amateur.
customer_reviews.text: Understand what this is. A reasonably priced set of tools for the individual. I just used the included pin removal tool to take several links out of a new watch I got my Mom. I know why some people have problems, they just ham-handedly put the band in and start turning. I took my time, carefully lined up the pin and the driver and, easy as pi, it worked. The back removal tool is the same. Set it up right, adjust it twice, and be careful using it and it works so easy. Watches are precision items, treat them as such, read the enclosed booklet, and this set should do very well by you.
customer_reviews.author: emv

customer_reviews.title: All of the screwdrivers in this kit are too "thick" for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: The kit is attractive and well laid out in a sturdy zip pouch. The band pin tool works fine. The back tool worked well enough for me to unscrew the back off of the two watches I needed to get into. The bad news: I needed to remove the screws holding a Bulova Accutron battery in place. None of the screwdrivers in this particular kit fit the screws. All of the screwdrivers in this kit are too "thick" for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: De Freev

customer_reviews.title: Dig deep in the 1300 then some reviews
customer_reviews.text: Don't be overwhelmed by the number of reviews and high average. With digging I found reviews that explain exactly what I take as reservations against this product. It is of low quality, but packaged nicely. The pin pusher just twists in an orbit when you screw it in, low quality metal for the screw drivers... Just all in all wouldn't have bought it if I found those reviews. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: N. S. ALSINAN

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality set of tools!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice beginning tool set, containing most of the things needed for basic repairs and battery replacement. It has almost everything most people would need, although I also purchased a press to put watch backs on. I am not going to use this set for a business, so I don't need a professional set, but most of these tools look like they could be used for quite a while. I recommend this tool set highly. Especially like the instruction manual included with the set: in well written English with no typos
customer_reviews.author: crazyhorse357

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just for the pry back tool, strap removal tool, and link pin removal tool. All work well. Can't comment on the case back wrench as I've not had any reason to use it yet. The instruction manual is for absolute beginners and even goes into basic watch terminology. You get quite a lot in a decent zip up case for your money. If you use even just a few of the tools regularly, it's worth it. I wish it had a case back holder (to hold the watch while using the case back wrench)- though that the instruction manual notes it as something not included that you may want to pick up.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rawlings

customer_reviews.title: ez watch repair kit money saver
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 different watches that I needed to replace batteries. The book included was very helpful explaining how repair various watch types. The tool to rotate one of the watch covers worked well. The tiny screw drivers were necessary to lossen a screw to get the battery out and back in. Have not tried to use the link band tool yet (didn't need to) so I cant comment on it yet. Just make sure you have a bright light and a magnifying glass or an eye loop as watch parts are small and hard to see the tiny screws. 2 battery replacements and the tool is paid for.
customer_reviews.author: dennis50

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch repair kit and company
customer_reviews.text: It sure appears to me that the watch repair kit has everything to do the job. I'm extremely impressed with the manufacturer, who went as far as to send me a note A) making sure there wasn't any damage B) that they stand behind there product. I have to pinch myself, in my 60 year's I don't believe I've run into such a great seller, (with the exception of Amazon of course). Buy this product with the confidence that your buying the best.
customer_reviews.author: M. Green

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out budget watch repair kit and handbook that does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Very well thought assortment of the essential tools necessary for changing batteries or straps on most all watches, perhaps even changing a movement. A bigger bonus is the well written knowledgeable handbook on basic watch repair. I appreciate the candid comment that this is an entry point tool kit, not intended to disassemble and refurbish your grandfather’s mechanical Swiss watch. The writer even recommends that as one’s skills improve replacing the tools individually with higher quality pieces. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: I’m a watch maker now... at least I feel like if I am
customer_reviews.text: You have everything in here! It came with a manual! And they sent you an email inviting you to be part of their family! For this price?! They made me feel like I’m a watch designer, fixing and building watches like in the XVII century, and I just fixed one bracelet and changed two batteries! Everything its way more easy with this tools, and you can do whatever you want without damaging your watches trying to do it with any other tools that wasn’t made for this, and come on, it’s cheap for everything that it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Agustin Palmero

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit for Watch Repair
customer_reviews.text: I love this kit. it has all of the tools you need to fix a watch and allowed me to replace the battery on my Swiss Army watch for the cost of the battery rather than the $25 a local shop charges. My only issue is the turn wheel for the top two guides on the wrench tends to hang up and takes a while to get to the right size, but once adjusted for the watch back, it opens the watch with ease. Excellent booklet with pictures comes with it and all the tools fit in the zippered case provided.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Bosso

customer_reviews.title: Only kit you should need!
customer_reviews.text: I have several dozen watches from Timex to Invicta to a few high-enders I won't list. This tool fits all the case backs to change a battery plus a tool to remove the links to shorten the watch bands or to swap out a band. Since I can't go out I will be playing with this to replace all my batteries and fine tune a few bracelet bands!! Very happy with this purchase and it certainly didn't break the bank. I highly recommend this kit...plus the blue case is a killer!!
customer_reviews.author: bullseyeharry

customer_reviews.title: Illegibly printed booklet makes kit worthless, email address dead
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that the booklet of expert advice this kit alone offered was so badly printed many pages were illegible. Which makes the kit worthless, long after I reached for the kit and the return window expired. I assumed any Amazon product's how-to guidebook would be properly printed when I reached for the kit weeks later. An manufacturer replace the booklet with a legible one? The tools are probably fine but the advice is hopelessly garbled in the booklet I got. How can you help? Paul Weis weistream@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Paul Weis

customer_reviews.title: Great kit to do it yourself
customer_reviews.text: This kit has made quick work of removing/replacing pins in watch band links in watch bands (Citizen and Fossil), removing/replacing silicone athletic watch straps (Timex Ironman), and removing screw-on and pressure plates to replace watch batteries (Fossil and a generic). Sure there is a learning curve but reading the directions and taking your time make this a great set to have on hand if you are a watch owner.
customer_reviews.author: mrcoachkline

customer_reviews.title: Great little first aid kit for your watch! Money saver!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a certified watch repair specialist. Just a regular gal trying to save money changing her own watch batteries or link adjustments. With that being said, it was pretty easy for me to use without reading the instructions. I eyeball what is for what and yep that’s pretty much it. Tools work fine. Kit seems to be practical for what I’m using it for. Really glad I got it. Watch battery replacement costs me $35-$50 depending on the jewler. Cheaper places refused to change it worrying about the liability for my watches invase they might cause damages. This kit saved me a lot of money and time! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good For The $
customer_reviews.text: I only received the kit yesterday and have worked on 2 watches. I read through the booklet, which is a good basic starter. The pictures are adequate to get you started. The rest comes with experience. One watch had a screw-on back. I located the appropriate tips for the case wrench, made the adjustment as directed, and within seconds had the back removed. The other was a pry-off back and the case opener tool did the job. All in all, this kit, for the price, should be just fine for replacing batteries and working on wrist bands. For pry-off backs, I highly recommend getting a back case cover press. I have one on order.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Fair quality, got the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a long slit cut in the case and the tool for removing a band from the watch broken and deformed. Pretty sure someone used it and returned it. Was able to shorten my watch band. Not worth the hassle of arguing with the seller to return and replace at this price point. Didn't have to go to a jewelry store, so that was nice.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Quality kit, makes adjustments and repairs simple .Booklet explains info concisely and completely.
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased a few watches and I needed to resize the watchbands. This kit was perfect, worked very well and included all the tools needed to perform multiple tasks. I had to contact the vendor and their customer service is extraordinary! Contacted me immediately. Thanks very much for a great kit that's incredibly easy to use once you have the necessary information provided in the booklet about the maintenance and tasks that you need to perform. Highly recommend this compact kit for any home watch repairs that don't need a Rolex watchmaker. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Pretty comprehensive, adding/removing links
customer_reviews.text: This has been helpful in prying apart watches and changing batteries, however, I did have to go buy a press to put the backs back on snap-back style watches. It's a handy kit to have around especially for changing watch band links and for that it's worth the money and hassle of going into a jewelry store. I have not used all the tools included but those that I have used are decent for light and occasional use. Again, for the cheap snap-back style watches you may have to buy another type of tool for that.
customer_reviews.author: NoRegerts

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit - recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice watch repair guy, but a handy man. Now I'm fixing watches with no problem. I can fix any watch I encounter now - can even take links out of watch bands or put them back in place. Battery replacement is very easy now with the right tools. Watch batteries are easy to find on Amazon, and at great low prices. Between the instruction book, and you tube videos you'll be an expert watch repair person in no time !0)
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Great tool set!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously the tools are not high end, but they definitely get the job done. I purchased this kit since I had 3 dead watches that needed new batteries. Last time I went to a jeweler, I paid over $10.00 for a simple battery change. There's nothing complicated about changing a battery, so I decided to give this kit a try. Since I got this kit, I've changed all three batteries and adjusted multiple oyster straps from my watches. This kit has already paid for itself in less than 3 month. I strongly recommend this tool kit for anyone looking to maintain their watches running and avoid paying ridiculous prices for simple battery changes.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Vélez

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Movado series 800
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tool set to replace the battery on my Movado series 800. Tried a few other sets and none of them have the right pins to open the case, until I got this set. Took me 10 minutes to replace the battery on my Movado series 800 watch and save $$$. I am not a professional watch repair, so, the tool set seems good quality and does the job well. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: sqa4life

customer_reviews.title: You don't have to be afraid of getting junk on this one!
customer_reviews.text: This kit is more quality than others on this site for sale. Customer service is great, the book is very very helpful to newcomers to watch repair do it yourselfers. Excellent tools, well made, the only thing you will need in addition is the watch back removal tool for larger size watches, mostly men's. And customer service told me they were going to include that soon. A good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool kit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new watch with a bracelet and needed to size it properly. With all the COVID stuff going on, my normal spot has been closed for quite some time. I decided to buy this kit and try my hand and sizing a watch bracelet for the first time. To my surprise, it was quite easy to use and I was able to complete the process in about 15 minutes. If a rookie can figure this kit out, I'm quite certain people that are watch hobbyists would be very pleased with the overall quality of these tools. I do wish the the watch pin removal tool was made out of metal versus plastic, but overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Allwuest

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This kit was cheap and you get what you pay for. The pry bar case back opener is super cheap and the edge simply broke off one day. The pin pusher is the next bad piece. It's so cheap it bent when pushing pins. Why this is so highly rated, i do not know. I would rather have spent more money and gotten good equipment. Good if you want cheap and inexpensive though.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The tool kit arrived in tact and also has a nice case to keep all the tools in. There was no description or index to explain what each tool was used for. I had to look at youtube to learn how to remove links from a watch band. Would have been helpful to include a tool description and maybe a basic instruction for things like removing a link or replacing a battery.
customer_reviews.author: mayra

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE REPAIRS MADE SIMPLE
customer_reviews.text: If you are doing simple things like changing batteries, watch bands, and similar tasks this kit is great. If you want to go beyond that, the tools are helpful--but the booklet on repairs is NOT. The manual is very limited in the information it gives. A little more detail would have been helpful. A lot more, would have been ideal! Despite this, I was able to use the kit to repair a small pendulum clock that had not run for some decades, and snug loose pocket watch works in their case. Was it worth the cost? Yes--but I will be investing in texts with a little more meat,
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Pifer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I was really just looking for a tool to change watch batteries, but this looked like a nice set, so I went ahead and bought it. The quality looks to be good, and everything that was promised was in the case. The documentation was very clear and well written; unlike what some others have said, there was a printed booklet in the case that had a lot of good photos and useful tips. The documentation appeared to be written by someone who actually knew how to repair watches rather than by someone who was just selling a tool kit.
customer_reviews.author: Rich W

customer_reviews.title: lots of handy stuff at a good price
customer_reviews.text: worked very well for watchband adjust: sliding off the removable pins and remove the unwanted link - However, the enclosed screwdrivers are of poor quality and could not handle a simple job like replacing the battery in another watch - I suggest to replace them with better-ones - I had on hand a set of ECLIPSE from England - perfect for the job. However Amazon US has a variety of screwdrivers sets from 7 dollars to 99 dollars of far better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Giorgio Via

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set of tools for a do-it-yourselfer. Finding the correct batteries for my wristwatches has become an iffy chore but someone to actually install them much more difficult. So... I decided that it would be much easier to get the right tools and do it myself. This set was my final choice and after removing the covers (two screwed on and one snap on) with the proper tools was no problem. I ordered the batteries and replacement gaskets from Amazon and am awaiting those items to get the watches running again. The instruction booklet is a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Hicova

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.  Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good set for your personal watches. The tools are good enough for occasional use....(a bit on the cheap side)....but at the price, this is to be expected. I have used this set to adjust bands on my Seiko, Skagen, Movado, and a couple replicas. I have changed out batteries in a couple Seikos. I bought an additional set with a case clamp and 2-point case wrench for easier case opening to compliment this set and cover some of its shortcomings. The case is a little too small, but will barely fit everything it comes with inside. There is absolutely no room for expansion.
customer_reviews.author: FierceGT

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tool kit !
customer_reviews.text: The kit has what I need to open the back of a watch to replace the battery & add or remove links in the watch band. To be complete it should have a press tool to snap the back into place without cracking the crystal. I did appreciate the helpful hint the seller provided to press the back into place in lieu of an actual press but for me that didn't work !
customer_reviews.author: Steve 50

customer_reviews.title: Great kit.
customer_reviews.text: The kit had everything that I needed to replace the battery in my RELIC watch. When the kit came in I inspected the items I would need to remove the watch back. There was a problem with a defective peg that would not screw into the tool. I sent an email to the seller to find out how to get a replacement for the peg. Within two days I received an entire new kit and everything in it was perfect. I am impressed with the quick response of the seller and am pleased with the kit. The booklet with the kit is very informative and I am glad that I chose the EZTool product. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners learning about Watches as a hobby
customer_reviews.text: This is actually really helpful. I haven't used all the tools yet but I've been working on a few watches with changing batteries, cleaning the internals, and even Changing straps. It's been very helpful. The little pocket sized book it comes with is actually a quality textbook like instruction manual with information, lighthearted very mild humor to keep you involved, and images of what you may come across. It is targeting beginners with watch repair so you may know some of what is in it but in my opinion unless you're professionally going to school for watch making, it's a good way to start. If someone I know wants to get into tinkering with watches I would recommend this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you 1000 times!
customer_reviews.text: Have had the kit a few days and have already easily replaced 7 batteries and repaired two watches and saved over $250 in exorbitant repair/battery replacement fees. No more trips to the jewelers! Buy the two main replacement batteries on Amazon and youre good! I am an obsessive watch collector owner of dozens of watches. Take it from me this kit has EVERYTHING you need to get and keep your timepiece moving like clockwork! And you will save a ton of money!! Best money ive spent in many moons!
customer_reviews.author: Dr Know

customer_reviews.title: Get the kit before purchasing batteries, in order to make sure you get the correct types
customer_reviews.text: I have been taking my watches to a repair shop for years; paying an unbelievable amount to replace batteries or adjust bands. Sometimes batteries would only last for a few months, at best. This kit makes the process of replacing your own batteries super easy. In addition, replacing or changing bands (of all types) is a breeze with the attachments and tools included in the kit. The booklet that comes with the kit is worth gold, and is a big plus since; especially given so many companies nowadays want you to go online to get this type of detailed information. Great value and great product. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier L. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for the book!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the book, and to supplement #1 Best Seller Vastar 147 piece kit. There is overlap, but useful differences, too (for example, Vastar has many spare watch and tool parts). Duplication provides useful spares for cheap tools. YouTube videos a necessary supplement (for unusual slide-type bracelet links instead of pins, to start--not explained in either kit). Bought a watch back press, too, as the book recommends! Book is chatty (British, not Asian English), and a good fit for the tools provided.
customer_reviews.author: thejf1

customer_reviews.title: This product was amazing, I just changed out two watches batteries which ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a small man, no small hands either, XXL Golf and Softball gloved guy. This product was amazing, I just changed out two watches batteries which alone would have cost me the price of this product. That one company that sounds like an old rock would have charged me the cost of this product. If have the patience to do fine work this can help you out!! The only small drawback was the case, it's not as clean fitting as the picture, it doesn't take away the performance of the tools but it's not as clean as the photo, the hammer doesn't have a home in there.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Folk

customer_reviews.title: DIY? Okay!
customer_reviews.text: Almost everything you need is here, including a well-written and illustrated booklet describing how to do the most basic of watch repair. I promptly bent the link pin on the link pin remover (entirely my fault), but they have anticipated this misfortune and included extras. USS has been in touch with me via e-mail, and they have provided me with handy (and timely) advice. I could not be more happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable for the occasional tinkerer
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a couple of old watches I had sitting around and the tools worked well enough. These tools are not really professional grade however they are serviceable enough for a casual hacker. Most folks will likely just want to remove the back to change a battery or adjust a bracelet and this kit will allow them to do that just fine.
customer_reviews.author: PCR

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Chose this tool set because of the all the good reviews, was not disappointed. The handle on the case opener looks a little worn but that could just be because of the manufacturer using subpar material, otherwise the toolset doesnt seem to be a returned item, since the seal on the outer bag was intact. The important parts of each tool seem sturdy. My husband has already replaced two watch batteries so its already paying for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Junie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for round back watches
customer_reviews.text: I thought it had a tool for watches with a smooth round back with no wedge openings or ridges to grab. Needs to lift the back straight off. Unfortunately, it doesn't appear that any of the tools work for this kind of watch back cover. The other tools appear useful for future work, but didn't solve my immediate need.
customer_reviews.author: Derek D.

customer_reviews.title: Need to have for watch people
customer_reviews.text: Just used this to adjust the band on my new watch. It worked awesome and only took a few minutes. The manufacturer is also very interested in your feedback and happiness with the product. I haven't used all the tools yet, but the provided manual seems very good and should make using the other tools a breeze. I didn't see any other products offered with this level of manual.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisMo

customer_reviews.title: weak parts, broke on first use!
customer_reviews.text: This is a comprehensive kit *in concept*, but the parts are made out of weak materials and the tools bent upon the first time I tried to use it! Especially the metal pins to use to remove pins from watch bands, for instance, are not a quality material and simply bent! not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Dan W

customer_reviews.title: Great watch repair kit and instruction manual!
customer_reviews.text: The watch repair kit and instruction manual are great for a beginner watch fix it guy. Since I remember replacing batteries use to cost $5.00, $8.00, $10.00 and now $15.00 I reealize that is a lot of money for replacing all the watches I have in my collection. It adds up quick and so places are even trying to charge $20.00! So this looks a great hobby for me since I love to where watches. I have used everything or the entire manual but this will be a perfect start. Especially, with EZTool Professional Watch Repair Kit making sure my items arrived in perfect condition and on time. Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: Summit

customer_reviews.title: Best kit in the market! you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this kit! I just needed to take same links of my watch bracelet, and this kit made it so simple and easy, just took me less than 5 minutes, the manual (which is included with the kit) is a plus. I have an Eco Citizen watch and the manufacture recommended an special tool, which I couldn't find online or take it to a experienced jeweler, which wanted to charge $50 for the job, well not need to spend that money, just buy this kit, and I can guarantee you will be satisfied. I will buy it again and will recommended to everybody.

customer_reviews.author: Alex STEPANIAN

customer_reviews.title: Great set must have
customer_reviews.text: Great product has everything you need to adjust bands ect I love this set . It's very well made . Only bad is the watch battery screw off tool was to small for my fossel back. Other then that works excellent. Highly recommended! ! Seller was there the whole time giving updates as merch was close, also contacted me personally to say thank you and making sure merch was exactly what I expected. Quality and bargin in same set!!! Get yourself one!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool set
customer_reviews.text: I only needed a couple of tools from this kit, but it was a pleasant surprise to explore all the tools provided. It was very educational and I learned a lot. Nowadays you have to send your watch out for battery replacement and I decided I would just try to do it on my own, and this kit was perfect for that. It has tools for quartz and other types of watches.
customer_reviews.author: Savirc

customer_reviews.title: Good kit for a DIY person on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Very complet kit. Includes tools for replacing batterys, straps and adjusting link bracelets. The spring bar tool feels solid and doesn’t bend easily. Some people in the reviews section don’t like the link pin remover. But if you replace the punch that comes mounted in the tool with one of the others included in the kit, you will have a much better first experience with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to open a watch case
customer_reviews.text: To me, the value of this kit is the tool to open the back of a watch to get to the battery. It takes a little adjusting, but once you get it set up, it works great. I used it on a small and a large watch with no trouble. There are a dozen other gadgets in the kit that I am sure I’ll use at some point. This is a good price for all you get.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: The watch back removal tool could use a little work. It's not "tight". The back removal tool is why I bought the kit. I had an excellent well machined one that disappeared. I collect watches and I'm not paying $20+ every time I need a $3 battery replaced. The rest of the tools are mediocre quality.
customer_reviews.author: jjsteel1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tools for beginners and helpful instructions and support.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent beginner tool kit for DIY watch maintenance. The full color Handout book is educational and usefu in describing the basics. Defitnetly recommended for anyone that has watches/smart watches as this kit will handle basic and beginner needs. A good starting point and the merchant responds rapidly to questions and follows up. I am satisfied with my purchase and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: seniorshinybutt

customer_reviews.title: Has everything!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little tool kit. For some of my watches, I had to go to a jeweler just to replace the battery. Watches ended up in my purse for months, never quite making it to the jewelry store. With the tools in this kit, I don't think I will ever have to do that again. Was also able to remove to links from a watch that I haven't been able to wear since I bought it two years ago. This kit has everything I need and more.
customer_reviews.author: theresa a.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Kit
customer_reviews.text: My son is into watches. He has a bit of a collection but needed tools to adjust bands, open watch backs for batter replacement and general maintenance and repair. This kit covered them all, from the cheapo wally world watches to the 800.00 designer watches and everything in between.
customer_reviews.author: x8v3n0m8x

customer_reviews.title: Most valuable tool
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with plenty of instructions I have a large watch collection and at$20 per battery replacement got to be quite expensive this tool box in one day earned my money back I don't know why they charge so much to change a battery it's so easy and with the virus a lot of stores don't even want to touch your watch
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Burrell

customer_reviews.title: Novice!
customer_reviews.text: I have replaced very few watch batteries. Being retired means that I have more time than money. Between my spouse and I we have 14 watches and replacing batteries gets expensive. This kit seems to have everything that is needed. The best part being the manual. The manual is very well written in English. It is concise, without being hard to understand. I was using the tools quickly with no issues. I saved $50.00 to $60.00. Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Corey M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I’ve little toolkit
customer_reviews.text: Nice little watch tool kit. Plenty of tools included to take care of the basics on just about any watch. Instructions were very good and communication from the seller was outstanding-including a few emails before the package arrived on how to use some of the most common tools. If you need a kit with all the basics-and then some, this is the kit for you, at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Watch repair for all.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a pro but I like to tinker and fixing watches falls into that category. This is a good kit that’s well thought out and supplied. The pouch is nice to keep everything thing together. Having the book is a big help. All n all - this is a great purchase and will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dawhip

customer_reviews.title: IT GOT THE JOB DONE
customer_reviews.text: I GOT THE COVER OFF AND THE BATTERY OUT OF MY POCKET WATCH, BUT IT SEEMS THE MFG HAS MADE IT NEXT TO IMPOSSIBLE TO INSTALL THE NEW BATTERY. I'LL BE TAKING IT TO A WATCH REPAIR CO, TO SEE IF THEY CAN FIGURE IT OUT. THE TOOL KIT DID ITS JOB GETTING THE COVER OFF. THERE WERE NO INDENTS IN THE COVER TO REMOVE IT AS IN THE OLDER WATCHES. I LIKE THE KIT.
customer_reviews.author: MORG

customer_reviews.title: Great Repair Kit
customer_reviews.text: If your in the market for a watch repair kit and have never attempted to take a watch apart and put it back together this is the right kit to start with. The difference is they include a How to Book which is invaluable. This company is also a mom & pop operation and are available to help guide you. In today’s environment it is unusual for a company to care after they made the sale. Highly recommend...Doug
customer_reviews.author: D. Heisey

customer_reviews.title: A good start but lacks quality.
customer_reviews.text: When you purchase this kit, you do in fact gain some knowledge and ability to do simple repairs and tuning yourself. However, the tools are cheap plastic and rough metals. Although it would be more expensive to buy higher grade versions of these tools individually, I find myself wishing I had done so in the first place. Ultimately, this kit was $15 at the time I bought it and I’ve saved that much by changing batteries and adjusting automatic pieces myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Very complete kit for the average person.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit so I could do some minor things on my watches..adjust bracelet links, get the different types of cases open for battery replacements, swapping bands, etc. The kits seems to include all the tools that I need for those tasks. The customer service followed up with me to make sure I was happy with the kit, so that was a nice touch too!
customer_reviews.author: ILikeBoots

customer_reviews.title: keep your timer ticking.
customer_reviews.text: the kit is good for regular watch sizes and novice the tool used to turn and remove the watch back cover is to small for my watches they are bid divers watches. other then that it's ok. I contacted the vendor and express my issue they offer me a reasonable solution and Refund a portion of the cost which was decent on their behalf. they take seriously considering on customer service and satisfaction and support.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Caban

customer_reviews.title: Great buy fun tool
customer_reviews.text: Game changer , with this kit making repairs to wrist band is a breeze changing out dead batteries easy as pie ,so why give your cash to a jeweler to replace a dead battery or toss watch in drawer because of dead battery. Battery can be purchased at most big box stores for pennies or on line for even less
customer_reviews.author: L E Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: In the instruction booklet, which is nicely written, it’s indicated the tools in the kit are for beginners and that if the buyer pursues watch repair, there are higher priced quality tools available. I appreciated the notice, but several of the tools included are very low quality, where using them is difficult. The tool for removing a pin a bracelet is an example - super cheap quality. The wrench for removing the back of the case does not work smoothly at all. If I had it to do over I’d spend more to getter better quality, and I’m just a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Allman

customer_reviews.title: pays for its self
customer_reviews.text: This kit and the book takes you step by step to do almost everything related to your watch. It payed for its self the first time I used it. If you have invicta watch you need this to take the links out. Jeweler was charging $3.00 per link. I have small wrist need I say more.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Worked great so far
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once to replace a battery in my Citizen watch, but it worked really well. The booklet was included with my kit and was surprisingly well done with full color pictures. The only negative so far is that the booklet is too large to store inside the kit itself, which means it is likely to get lost or not be nearby when I need it. Not a big deal though.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Why spend more than the cost of this kit to get your watch battery changed? Duh...
customer_reviews.text: I had an epiphany. Why spend more than the cost of this kit to get your watch battery(ies) changed? Duh........... In under a minute I was able to open a watch case to replace a battery that I'd needed to replace for years. I have about eight watches to do next. The color manual WHICH IS INCLUDED IN THE BOX was very helpful for those of us who didn't go to watch repair school. I'll update again after changing all the watches (and adjusting links on one). For now, five stars. I'm feeling so dumb that I paid like $30 to have a watch battery changed a few years back. No more!
customer_reviews.author: Rated R Cars

customer_reviews.title: Good watch kit
customer_reviews.text: Good watch kit. The booklet is awesome! I Just made my first repair using the new watch repair kit and booklet and couldn't be any more pleased with the results. Thanks to the booklets easy to follow insight and instruction, I was able to replace my first watch strap with considerable ease. The Kit arrived on time, and Universal Smart Solutions are right there too making sure everything is right. So far so good Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: marc p

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit
customer_reviews.text: I think for the price it is a good kit. I was able to use it for changing the links on the bands and opening the back, it has the tools necessary to change out spring bars etc. I think for me I need a more complete set of precision screw drivers to work on the smaller screws within the movement of the watch itself, the ones that came with the kit are not quite fine enough to fit those tiny slotted screws, but overall this kit is very useful for general maintenance and adjustments of your watches.
customer_reviews.author: W. L.

customer_reviews.title: The tool kit is great, and Gus wonderful to deal with
customer_reviews.text: The tool kit is great, and Gus wonderful to deal with. I have pro level tools and have done most of my own bracelet shortening, and watch battery changes for years. So much so that some of the tools were starting to get old and dull. Recently I was shortening a watch band and one of the pin pushers broke, sadly it is no longer made. However in looking I found this kit, which had the tools I needed and a great many more, in a well designed case. Now when I go to my mother's house, I just take this along for the inevitable repairs to her watches........
customer_reviews.author: elbee

customer_reviews.title: this is a nice kit
customer_reviews.text: I have to rebuild a watch bracelet which involves driving pins out, removing spring bars etc. this kit has the tools i need to do it. better quality than i expected. the little manual is intelligently written, all too infrequent in these days of declining literacy.
customer_reviews.author: j ferguson

customer_reviews.title: This kit worked great.
customer_reviews.text: The local jewelry store wanted $25 to change a watch battery. This kit cost $24. The battery cost $5. I changed the battery myself in under five minutes. I've always a set of tools like this. Now when my watch battery dies, it's just the beginning, instead of the end! SCORE!
customer_reviews.author: Shambling Strider

customer_reviews.title: Your go-to watch repair kit
customer_reviews.text: Great little watch case with everything needed to repair a watch. Only 1 problem, I tried everything and wasn’t able to get the back off my Michael Kors watch. The tool Provided wasn’t narrow enough. I need up bringing it to a watch repair place and he changed my battery in 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2travel

customer_reviews.title: Just what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: The organized case is perfect. This kit makes finding what tool you need extremely easy. The instructions makes watch repair so easy that I have repaired 5 of my watches already (yeah-I have many colored ones). With getting watch batteries replaced costing upward of $20 this kit will be worth much more than the cost quickly. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Buchan

customer_reviews.title: Its o.k just haedvti spring wheel to adjudt
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty well only problem I have is the 3 point adjustable backnremoval tool is a little loose and sloppy the thumb adjustment wheel jams up on frame think it'll be fine ine I take drimmel but to it to mahr a little space for clearance to adjust thumb wherl
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to & surpasses the kit’s high ratings
customer_reviews.text: Kit arrived quickly. All the tools I need for my at home watch work. The 40 page book explaining types of watches, how to open the different watch case backs, how to use the tools with clear photographs, and so much more is a treasure trove of information for the non-jeweler.
customer_reviews.author: drtmm17

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for a great price
customer_reviews.text: The kit came exactly as shown in the pictures and the included illustrated guide book is well put together and very helpful. I've never worked on a watch before but within a 30 minutes of opening the kit I had replaced a battery and taken a link out of a band. I'm using this for my, and my family's watches (not to make money) and look forward to using this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Erin H Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great kit. Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have already got my money’s worth out of this. I am a watch junkie and had several watches(7) that had bad batteries. I went to a store to ask how much to replace them and to fix them would have been $50. I also had to remove extra links from one of watches and using this kit; worked perfectly. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: Best watch kit
customer_reviews.text: Really great kit. I needed to resize a watch I purchased for my boyfriend and no jewelers were open because of the pandemic. It took me maybe 2 minutes to take 2 links out and move the clasp of the watch and get it to fit him perfectly. The book is super helpful and the ez tool for pin removal is easy to use and definitely a time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Manual alone is worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: The manual alone is worth the cost of the kit. Everything one needs just to deal with watch band adjustments or changing, and battery replacement is provided. Kicking myself for all the years I paid a jeweler anywhere from $8-$12 to replace a battery. You don't have to be a jeweler or watchmaker to do these tasks yourself for friends and family for years to come. Oh...on Amazon, the watch batteries run anywhere from less than $1 to $3 each.
customer_reviews.author: RandyK.

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice watch repair kit for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice watch repair kit for a beginner, although the one thing missing is a screw driver with a small enough blade to open the backs of watches that are secured by very tiny screws. I have a couple of Raymond Weil watches that have four screws securing the backs and the screw drivers that came with this kit are simply too large to work. Thus, now I will have to purchase separately a set of watch repair drivers. Other than this negative feature, the EZTool kit seems like a good value, one that could have been a great value with the right diameter screw driver.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Elegant Lifestyles

customer_reviews.title: Very nice kit
customer_reviews.text: My only interest in the kit was to change a watch battery. I got the back off in about 5 minutes without damage. All the tools look very useful for any kind of miniature work. The booklet is just some basics but very easy to read and is at least a start.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Already paid for itself!
customer_reviews.text: I love watches, and this kit is going to save me a ton of time & money by not having to take them to a jeweler to get links removed. I've used the link removal tool twice so far and it works flawlessly. It even comes with a full instructional guide on watch repair if I ever decide to try any of that on my own. It's also really nice to have a separate case so I can have all of my watch tools all in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Howard R.

customer_reviews.title: Many different tools, average quality
customer_reviews.text: This kit comes with a manual which is helpful. It contains many different tools, also good. The tools don't seem like they are built to last very long, one of the link remover pin broke the first time I used it, but towards the end so I still got the job done. It has three different size pins to remove the link so I'm sure I could still continue to use it however I was slightly disappointed. It's still a useful kit though. Another thing, yes there are many tools but the case is rather small than it should be, so all the tools are kind of stuffed in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great help replacing watch batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought this to change the batteries of the many watches I have that need replaced. I was able to open almost all of the watches, except two. The tweezers came in handy to remove the dead battery. I was amazed how inexpensive the replacement batteries were. Definitely saves money replacing them yourself. This kit helped me do that.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: The best you'll ever spend to adjust your watches and change the battery!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is an amazing purchase! It has all the tools you need and the instructions that are provided are one of a kind and so helpful. Considering the fact that our local guy charges $12 to adjust a watch band, I'd say that this kit payed for itself after I adjusted the second watch. Now, let's talk about the items. The case is made of a strong, versatile canvas. The tools inside are of good quality and are perfect for the average person that wishes to work on their own watches.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Austin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners!!
customer_reviews.text: (PRO’s) This product is perfect for a complete starter to working on watches. Comes with everything that you need as a beginner. Very simple follow along instruction booklet. (Cons) Since this is a starter kit, do not expect the tools to be high quality. Some of the smaller pieces will bend with little ease, some of them are super sturdy. There are better pieces out there that can be added to your own kit once you get out of the beginner stage. Overall this is a great item for first time “do-it-yourself” persons. Happy with the purchase but will replace certain items over time with better quality ones.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Horan II

customer_reviews.title: Wrench is too small.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first watch repair tool kit. The instructions are extremely basic and of little help. The idea of a self-help manual was appealing when I purchased this product, but I was disappointed. The wrench that opens the screw-type watch backs was too small for my Casio watches. Since this was my first purchase I was unclear and unaware wrenches could be too small. I wrote EZTool. They apologized and offered me an $8 refund. The pliers were terrible. The points didn't line up, were poorly ground, and misaligned. Useless. I haven't tried the other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good set for DYI
customer_reviews.text: The set is properly put together for amateur DYI minimal repair works on quartz watches and the the complimentary booklet is a plus. The precision tools are not of the greatest quality, but enough to replace a battery or a watchband, without adapting kitchen knives or larger screwdrivers to the purpose. The pouch is also a great compliment. I've received it last night and was able to replace two batteries by using the socket. Overall a very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lubeff

customer_reviews.title: Good value,  seems to be holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the kit for a few days, but I've already used it numerous times. I've swapped out several bands/spring bars, taken off a few case backs, and removed a battery, and taken out some links. For the price, it's great. I think I'll eventually add a larger spring bar removal tool (to help ease my arthritis pain when working with watches), and some better quality tweezers. Overall it's a great place to start, and gets you most of the basics for not much money.
customer_reviews.author: chanson green

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: This tool kit arrived in good condition and most importantly, it has been just what I needed to replace batteries in a number of watches. The instruction manual was also helpful. There are items in this kit that I have not yet used but anticipate using in the future. It is sohelpful to have it all together in a handy zippered canvas container.
customer_reviews.author: great expectations

customer_reviews.title: It's flimsy, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: I did the job on my Tissot watch. Not easy to use though: the tool is flimsy. I don't know if I was able to apply enough torque when putting the back plate back on, so my watch is probably no longer dive proof. Considering the price of ~$20 plus the $3 battery it's a steal compared to what I used to pay to the "professionals" to replace the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kovalenko
